q:
You are incharge of security in your organization. To increase the responsiveness of your application, you are using Redis as a cache. Which of the following statements about Redis are true?

Choose the correct argument for the mentioned statements:

Statements

  1. Redis uses all the well-known practices for writing secure code, to prevent buffer overflows, format bugs, and other memory corruption issues.
  2. The client can change the working dir of the program and the name of the dump file and this allows the client to write RDB files, which is a security issue that can easily lead to the ability to compromise the system.

a.option: Both statements are true and Statement 2 is correct explanation of Statement 1
Both statements are true and Statement 1 is correct explanation of Statement 2
Both statements are true but Statement 1 and Statement 2 are not related
Statement 1 is false but Statement 2 is true

q:
You are incharge of security in your organization. To increase the responsiveness of your application, you are using Redis as a cache. Which among the following are some of the essential security measures for Redis Implementation in its infrastructure?

  1. Do not Publicly expose the redis server
  2. Run Redis with minimum privileges
  3. Don't allow any outside traffic to the Redis port
  4. Always use the private mode
  5. Prevent Network sniffing
  6. Secure Redis Implementation with Redis Enterprise Cloud

You are incharge of security in your organization. To increase the responsiveness of your application you are using Redis as a cache. Redis has optional support for TLS on which of the following:

  1. All communication channels.
  2. Client connections
  3. Replication links
  4. Redis cluster bus protocol

You are incharge of security in your organization. To increase the responsiveness of your application, you are using Redis as a cache. When redis is executed with the default configuration and without any password, in order to gain access it enters a special mode. What is that special mode called?

You are incharge of security in your organization. To increase the responsiveness of your application, you are using Redis as a cache. Which of the following statements about Redis are true?

Statements

  1. Redis is very fast at serving queries. Many passwords per second can be tested by an external client.
  2. Redis has optional support for TLS on all communication channels, including client connections, replication links and the redis cluster bus protocol.
  3. Redis protocol has the concept of string escaping, so injection is impossible under normal circumstances using a normal library.
  4. Using the CONFIG command makes the client able to change the working dir of the program and the name of the dump file.

Suppose you are working on developing a spring boot application. To provide security to the application, you decide to use Spring Security which provides its own tags for jsp pages. To secure the view layer of the application you use the CsrfInput Tag. Which is the best location to place CsrfInput Tag?

Suppose you are working on developing a spring boot application. To provide security to the application, you decide to use Spring Security. It can be used to add security context to our test functions. Which of the following are valid annotations?

1. @WithMockCandidate

2. @WithMockDetails

3. @WithSecurityContext

Suppose you are working on developing a spring boot application. To provide security to the application you decide to use Spring Security, a framework that was started in 2003. You decide to use JWT for authentication. Where in the JWT header will you find information about the type of algorithm used?

Suppose you are working on developing spring boot applications. The important part is to secure the application. Spring security does the work for us by customizing the authentication process with customized authentication filters and providers. Assume you have built a login page using spring boot and you want to add security feature to it. Which of the following features are provided by spring security?

1. HTTP authorization

2. Remember me

3. Resource based authorization

4. Web form authentication

You have a collection 'transactiondb' in a database 'mybank. You have protected the database by allowing access to the authorized users. You need to update the database rights for the user.
Update the rights of the user 'alicesmith11' and password with a new password 'password@123', and allow the database read access to this user. You need to update the custom data as { title: "Cloud developer" } and grant privileges for 'find' and 'update' actions on a collection 'transactiondb'.
Which of the following queries can perform the above scenario?

Options

1.

> use mybank
> db.updateSecurity("alicesmith11'",{ pwd:"password@123", customData: {title:"Cloud developer" } })
> privileges:[{resource: {db:"mybank", collection: "transactiondb"}, actions:["find", "update" ]}]

2.

> use mybank
> db.revokeUser("alicesmith11'",{ pwd: "password@123", customData: { title: "Cloud developer"}} )
> privileges:[{ resource:{db: "mybank", collection:"transactiondb"}, actions:["find", "update" ] }]

3.

> use mybank
> db.updateUser( "alicesmith11",{ pwd: "password@123", customData: { title: "Cloud developer"}} )
> privileges:[{ resource:{db:"mybank", collection:"transactiondb"}, actions:["find", "update" ] }]

4.

> use mybank
> db.changeUserPassword("alicesmith11",{pwd: "password@123", customData:{title:"Cloud developer"} })
> privileges:[{ resource:{db: "mybank", collection:"transactiondb"}, actions:["find", "update" ] }]

You are building a C# application in .Net 4.0 when you come across the code snippet shown alongside.

Which of these types of attacks in your application will this code mitigate:

Code snippet

XmlReaderSettings settings = new XmlReaderSettings();
settings.DtdProcessing = DtdProcessing.Prohibit;
XmlReader reader = XmlReader.Create(stream, settings);

You want to protect all methods on beans declared in the application context whose classes are in the com.mycompany package and whose class names end in "Test".
Code

<global-method-security>
 <X expression="execution(* com.mycompany.*Test.*(..))"
 access="ROLE_USER"/>
 </global-method-security>


In the given context, which of the following would be valid values of X?

Options

1.

protect-pointcut

2.

protect-aspect

3.

protect-advice

4.

AspectJ-Protect

Ben designed a website that is used for various food delivery operations from various restaurants. He wants to implement various RESTful web services to perform various functions for the website. Now, which of the following security measures that he must follow while designing this RESTful web service in this scenario:

Security measures

  1. All inputs on the server should be validated and the server should be protected against SQL or NoSQL injection attacks.
  2. Always use username, password, or session token in a URL, these values should be passed to Web Service via the POST method.
  3. Allow restricted use of methods like GET, POST, and DELETE methods. The GET method should not be able to delete data.
  4. A web service method should use HTTP error messages like 403 to show access forbidden, etc.

Alice is working for a library. She has developed RESTful Web Services for that library to perform various tasks such as getting the different catalog entries, returning the issued book, or issuing a new book available in the library. One day, Bob tried to delete the available list of books from the books API. Now, the librarian wants the RESTful Web Services that is constructed around his library operations to be secured such that only he has access to make changes in the API of the library. Alice has secured the API information by implementing HTTPS in it. If she has implemented a Secure Socket Layer (SSL) in this procedure, which of the following statements represent the advantages of using this protocol in this scenario:

Statements

  1. The authentication credentials can be simplified to a randomly generated access token.
  2. The server will compare the current timestamp to the request timestamp and only accept the request within a reasonable timeframe.
  3. The token is delivered in the username field of HTTP Basic Auth.

In Databricks, you are working on the authentication using Databricks personal access tokens in SQL Analytics. If you are required to use a personal access token to access the Databricks REST API, which of the following bash commands is used pass the token to the Bearer Authentication:
Bash commands
1.

curl -u : -X GET 'Authorization: Bearer ' https:///api/2.0/sql/endpoints/

2.

curl -n -X GET 'Authorization: Bearer ' https:///api/2.0/sql/endpoints/get?id

3.

curl -X GET -H 'Authorization: Bearer ' https:///api/2.0/sql/endpoints/

In Databricks, you are working on the Databricks SQL Analytics. Which of the following statements about the security statements are correct:
Statements

  1. The statement DENY denies a privilege on an object to a user or principal.
  2. The statement RMV removes all the privileges associated with a table.
  3. The statement REVOKE revokes an explicitly granted or denied privilege on an object from a user or principal.

In Snowflake, you are working on the implementation of the secure data sharing. Which of the following statements about the Shares are correct:
Statements

  1. They are the Snowflake objects that encapsulate all of the information required to share a database.
  2. Each Share consists of the privileges that grant access to the database(s) and the schema containing the objects to share.
  3. Each Share consists of the privileges that grant access to the specific objects in the database.

In Snowflake, you are working on various GRANT privileges. If you are required to grant the global CREATE DATA EXCHANGE LISTING privilege to 'sysadmin' role in a Data Exchange, then which of the commands must be executed in this scenario:

Statements

1.

use role accountadmin;

grant create data exchange listing on account to role sysadmin;

2.

use role accountadmin;

grant create share on account to systadmin;

 

3.

use role accountadmin;

grant select data exchange on account to systadmin;

In Databricks, you are working on the data object previleges of the Table access control from the Databricks Workspace. You are implementing the Data Governance model. Now, which of the following securable objects of this model is used to control the access to the underlying filesystem such that the user that are granted with this securable object can bypass the restrictions put on the catalog, databases, tables, and views by reading from the filesystem directly?
In TFS, which of the following authorization tokens is used to authenticate Azure DevOps?
In Windows, which of the following allows administrators to specify and enforce application trust boundaries by limiting the scope where application services can act on the behalf of a user?
In Windows, which of the following is a challenge-response style authentication protocol and also provides the feature of session security?

In Windows, what are the characteristics of the Datacenter Firewall:

  1. It is a network layer.
  2. It is a 3-tuple firewall.
  3. It is a stateful firewall.
  4. It is a multitenant firewall.

You are configuring the security vulnerabilities in the Windows debugger. Which of the following conditions monitoring the security problems during kernel-mode debugging are correct:

  1. If you use destructive extension DLLs, they can cause your debugger to affect the target computer.
  2. Destructive symbol files can influence your debugger to affect the host computer.
  3. If you are running a remote debugging session, an unexpected client might attempt to link to your server.

In the .NET framework, which of the following statements about the security in Windows Forms are correct:

  1. Code-access security affects all managed code that targets the common language runtime even if that code does not make a single code-access-security permission check.
  2. If the user runs a Windows Forms executable file directly off a Web server or a file share, then the degree of trust granted to the application depends on where the code is available.
  3. When an application runs, it is automatically evaluated and it receives a named permission set from the common language runtime.
In Windows, which of the following interfaces can be used to access the Kerberos authentication client that is implemented as a security support provider (SSP)?
In cloud computing, the ____________________ requires the use of at least one additional authentication mechanism besides usual that uses passwords.
In cloud computing, companies may adopt _________________________ to simplify the hassles of multiple authentication across several applications.

In cloud computing, the data security can be ensured by adding an additional mode for verification for users of service besides the authentication password. This is termed as _______________________________.

In cloud computing, the situation when a cloud-based service is besieged with a large number of fake (artificially-created) service requests due to which it is not able to take up genuine service requests from customers is known as _____________________.
In cloud computing, you should _____________________ to restrict the confidentiality of your cloud-hosted data.

a.option: Restrict the access to your information
Limit the resources availability to that dataset
Keep a local copy of your data

q:
In Google Cloud Platform, you are working on the security tools for the data logging. Which of the following audit logs are maintained by the cloud audit log for each project of your organization:

  1. Admin activity 
  2. Policy denied
  3. Data access 
  4. Server management

Select the correct statements about the Spring Security?

i. It is a customizable framework that provides extensive support for both Authentication and Authorization to Java Applications.

ii. Servlet API integration Optional integration with Spring Web MVC.

iii. It provides protections against Cross Site Request Forgery, SQL injections, Click Jacking.

iv. It does not provide any protection against Session Fixation.
In Express.js, which of the following web-servers would you use to enable the security feature that would prevent the sniffing attack and the man-in-the-middle attack in Ajax POST requests?

In Express.js, in order to prevent the cross-site scripting attacks and to deal with other security concerns, you have decided to use the helmet package. How does the use of this package prevent such attacks?

a.option: It does so by setting the Content-Security-Policy header.
It does so by enabling the TLS.
It does so by removing the X-Powered-By header.
It does so by disabling client-side caching.

q: In Networking, which of the following statements about PGP is correct?

a.option: It is used to secure a network.
It is used to secure emails.
It is used to secure HTTP.
It is used to secure HTTPS.

q: In Networking, if a large number of packet data are sent to a particular host by a DoS attacker, what is the process called?

In MS SQL, you are working on the security features of the SQL Database. Which of the following encryption techniques is used to encrypt your data at rest and does not require the changes to the applications that are accessing the encrypted database?
In Windows, what are the advantages that the Datacenter Firewall provides to cloud service providers?

a.option: It is a highly scalable, manageable, and diagnosable software-based firewall solution that can be offered to tenants.
It allows you to move tenant virtual machines to different compute hosts without breaking tenant firewall policies.
The firewall rules are configured in each vSwitch port irrespective of the actual host running the virtual machine.

q: Which annotation is used with @Configuration class to have the Spring Security configuration defined ?
In Networking, which of the following does the WPA2 secure?

In Google Cloud Platform, you are working on the security tools for the data logging. Which of the following statements represent the use of the Access Transparency tool in this scenario:

  1. For verifying that the Google Personnel are accessing your content only for business and data migration reasons.
  2. For verifying and tracking compliance with legal or regulatory obligations.
  3. For collecting and analyzing the tracked access events through an automated security information and event management (SIEM) tool.

In Express.js, if your application suffers from Insecure Deserialization of requests and responses during a vulnerability test, then which of these types of attacks the application would be susceptible to?

  1. XXE
  2. Replay attacks
  3. Privilege escalation attacks

In Express.js, if you are constructing your cookie policy in order to maximize security, then which of these practices would you follow to ensure the maximum cookie security:

  1. You should set the cookie option as httpOnly.
  2. You should never set the domain option path.
  3. You should never set the domain option domain.

In Express.js, assume that your application is vulnerable since there are attackers who detect apps running Express and subsequently launch custom tailored attacks. Which of the following actions would you take to prevent this?

a.option: You will disable the X-Powered-By header.
You will set the Content-Security-Policy header.
You will hide the X-Content-Type-Options header.

q: In Express.js, which of these features would you use to prevent the sniffing attack and the man-in-the-middle attack in Ajax POST requests?
In Networking, which of the following is known as a network of malicious devices?
In Networking, if a large number of half-open or fully-open TCP connections are created at a particular host by a DoS attacker, what is the process called?

In Google Cloud Platform, you are working on the cloud audit logs in the security logging. If you are required to export your audit logs, then which of the following actions must be performed in this scenario:

  1. If you are required to export your audit log entries outside of your logging region, then you are required to create a log sink.
  2. If you are required to export your audit log entries of a project of your Google cloud organization, then you are required to review your aggregated sinks.
  3. At the exporting destination, you can utilize 512 KiB as the maximum size of a data access audit log.

In Google Cloud Platform, you are working on the cloud audit logs in the security logging. Which of the following audit logs contains the log entries for Google Cloud administrative actions that modify the configuration of resources?

In MS SQL, you are working on the security features for your SQL Database. You have created a new key in Key Vault. If you are required to delete this key from Key Vault, then which of the following PowerShell parameters are required to restore this key to Key Vault by using the Restore-AzKeyVaultzKey cmdlet command:
    1. VaultName
    2. InputFile
    3. KeyID

In Google Cloud Platform, you are working on the Binary Authorization security tool. If you are required to secure your data by using the VPC Service Controls, then which of the following statements about these controls are correct:

  1. These controls improve the ability to reduce the risk of unauthorized copying or the transfer of data from your Google-managed services and resources.
  2. These controls can protect your data resources and services by adding this tool to the security perimeter.
  3. If you are using this tool for separation of duties by using individual Google cloud projects for deployments and attestations, then each such project can not be included in your VPC Service controls perimeter.
In Express.js, if you want to ensure that the brute-force attacks are not effective against login endpoints, then which of these would you not use to block the authorization attempts?

a.option: Number of consecutive failed attempts by the same user name and IP address
Number of failed attempts from an IP address in a fixed time period such as one day
Number of failed attempts from related IP addresses in a fixed time period such as one month
All of these are valid metrics
